primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from the existential fear of extinction (death as the end of love and identity) to the certainty of eternal life through the victory of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: I have the keys of hell and of death
our Champion has met the rider of the pale horse and has unseated the rider

object.identificatie: The Power of an Endless Life / Victory over Death
tekstueel_bewijs: the power of life over death
abolished death, and hath brought life and immortality to light

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Just Creator
tekstueel_bewijs: Thou hast made him, thou art just
God can and will bring to pass the power of life over death
Because I live, ye shall live also
we shall enter there by his grace

helper.identificatie: The Word of Jesus / The Testimony of the Apostles (John on Patmos)
tekstueel_bewijs: we shall rest our final confidence upon the word and work of One
the word of men and women who lived and experienced... the resurrection
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (The 'Lord of the church' opening visions)

tegenstander.identificatie: Death / The King of Terrors / The Rider of the Pale Horse
tekstueel_bewijs: the rider of the pale horse
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is treated not as a natural transition but as an 'alien army' and a 'terrifying fear' that humans cannot overcome by reason.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The call to be a 'confessing Christian' who remains faithful under trial, modeled by John on Patmos.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical call to 'be found guilty of being a believer' is presented as a response to the primary victory of Christ.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God can and will bring to pass the power of life over death
Christ has met and conquered the king of terrors
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We stake our claim to resurrection
We fear that it may not be so

voorbeelden: everyone born into the world is born into serious business
I want to be guilty of that, do you not, also?
we long for life beyond this life
I do not know how to die
we are just beginning to understand... what life is all about
I cannot unlock the door, but I have a Friend who has keys
God can and will bring to pass

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability to escape death) being met by Christ's 'pouvoir' (sovereign power/keys).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Death), moves to ~S1 (Fear/Illusion), then Christ intervenes as ~S2 (The Keys) to bring the hearer to S1 (Life).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by human reason (~S1) but by the historical and cosmic 'work' of Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Death is described as a 'terrifying fear' and a 'noble heart' cracking forever.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While there is a brief moral exhortation regarding worship, the 'engine' of the sermon is Christ's active victory over a cosmic opponent that the human subject cannot defeat.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Some of you who are very lax in your regularity of worship do not know what a privilege it is

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Christ as the Active Subject of Salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Our Champion has met the rider of the pale horse and has unseated the rider.
I do not know how to die... I cannot unlock the door.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John on Patmos is used as a model of a 'confessing Christian,' but the focus quickly shifts from John's character to the Vision of Christ he receives.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by showing John 'falling as dead' before Christ, emphasizing Christ's majesty over John's effort.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and assurance; moving from existential dread to borrowed confidence.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic: Christ does the fighting and the unlocking; the believer receives the benefit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'philosophical interest' in death to the 'theological certainty' in Christ is seamless.
spanning_punten: The shift from the 'lovely faith' of family reunion to the 'terrifying fear' of illusion creates a strong narrative tension.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: met and conquered the king of terrors... unseated the rider

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the objective work of Christ than the subjective work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Moderate; sin is mentioned ('washed us from our sins'), but Death is the primary antagonist.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions Christ as the Subject and the hearer as the Receiver of a cosmic victory.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might feel judged by the 'laxity in worship' comment, shifting them from Receiver to a failing Subject.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Frame worship not as a duty (Devoir) but as a participation in the victory already won (Pouvoir).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the Easter theme well.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'Vouloir' (desire for reunion) more explicitly to the 'Pouvoir' of Christ.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's victory) clearly grounds the Ethics (Confessing faith).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of a Christus Victor narrative that avoids moralism by emphasizing the objective 'keys' held by Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of Tennyson and Handel; Greimas shows that these are 'Helpers' to the Subject's (Christ) mission.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek of Revelation 1; Greimas reveals the 'Champion vs. Rider' deep structure.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-Switch'—the preacher admits he cannot unlock the door, handing the Subject role to the 'Friend'.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses existential philosophy as a 'Sender' of questions, but only Christ as the 'Subject' of answers.
